questions.question: What are the names for Azure cloud hosted web sites
questions.answer: Azure Websites / Web Apps / App Services

questions.question: What model of XaaX does the Web Apps present?
questions.answer: PaaS - Platform-as-a-Service - It abstracts the VM "plumbing" for developers.

questions.question: Do media items have a published status?
What IaaS stand for?
questions.answer: Infrastructure-as-a-Service - Provides environment for running VM, with full control of them.

questions.question: What SDN stands for?
questions.answer: Software Defined Networking -  network connectivity, fiber routers, switches.

questions.question: What is Azure load balancer?
questions.answer: Azure load balancer distributes requests across Website instances. It operates on multiple web app instances int the same geographical region.

questions.question: What is Traffic Manager?
questions.answer: Traffic Manager allows to load-balance across geographic regions. Ones Web Sites will be replicated among data centers in defferent regions.

questions.question: What languages/tools Azure Web Sites support?
questions.answer: It supports: Asp.Net, Node.js, Php, Python.

questions.question: What are the Web App Deployment Models?
questions.answer:
1. Local or cloud based source control.
2. FTP(S) to Azure,
3. Web Deploy (package all files to zip file)
4. Visual Studio,
5. WebMatrix,
6. Windows PowerShell/Azure CLI.
